medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was awoken one night ago with severe, sharp epigastric pain in a band-like distribution. The pain had a sudden onset with no radiation and was worsened by turning, palpation, and riding in a car. The patient experienced improvement of pain allowing her to fall asleep again but continued to have mild abdominal pain upon waking on the morning of admission. Another episode of epigastric pain led to an urgent care appointment with her PCP, who noted abdominal tenderness with guarding.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hypercholesterolemia 2. Colon resection s/p polyp on colonoscopy - benign 3. Cholelithiasis 4. Pulmonary nodule with ? Mycobacterial infection
medical_history.family_history: Mother - deceased at age (not specified) with stroke; Father - deceased at age (not specified) with stomach cancer.
